definition: Shut up!/same as 閉上嘴巴|闭上嘴巴
to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct

sentences.english: When the patient shuts up, buccinator is very flabby, reason quarrel is flagging.
sentences.chinese: 患者闭嘴时，颊肌极为松弛，故口角下垂。

sentences.english: I bet 10-15 years from now, these fools will shut up.
sentences.chinese: 我打赌15年后，这些蠢蛋就会闭嘴。

sentences.english: After what you've said about 'Ephemera' I must be silent.
sentences.chinese: 在你说了关于蜉蝣的那些话之后我只好闭嘴了。

sentences.english: Beggars can't be choosers. You need to just clam up.
sentences.chinese: 乞丐没有选择，你还是闭嘴吧。

sentences.english: It's quietened a few people, which is always nice.
sentences.chinese: 这让一些人闭嘴，这很好。

sentences.english: Gidwin:Oh shut up, you dolt. You probably want to kiss her a hundred times.
sentences.chinese: 给我闭嘴，你这个笨蛋，你可能想要偷亲她一百次呢。

sentences.english: Qaddafi never seemed to shut up, and Libyans were his conscripted audience.
sentences.chinese: 卡扎菲似乎从不闭嘴，利比亚人则是被召集来的听众。

sentences.english: If you still got a problem with it, go cry and whine in a corner or STFU.
sentences.chinese: 如果你仍然有问题，去哭，在角落里抱怨或者闭嘴。

sentences.english: The crew of the Arctic Sea have been told to keep their mouths shut.
sentences.chinese: “北冰洋”号的船员已经被要求闭嘴噤声。

sentences.english: Success is the best weapon to silence scoffers.
sentences.chinese: 成功是让嘲笑者闭嘴的最好武器。

sentences.english: His remarks about her weight provoked her into telling him to shut up.
sentences.chinese: 他讲到她的体重，使得她叫他闭嘴。

sentences.english: "Shut up, Joe, " I say. "We know what you want.
sentences.chinese: “闭嘴，乔，”我说，“我们知道你想要什么。

sentences.english: "Shut up, " Golz had said in English.
Like, shut up. you're a moron.
Shut up you little bitch, he's trying to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 闭嘴你个小贱人，他想睡觉了。

sentences.english: When Vinnie entered the room, Mary clammed up.
sentences.chinese: 文尼已进入房间，玛丽就闭嘴了。

definition: to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
to open one's eyes wide/to stare/to glare (at sb)/to scowl
to leave/to walk away/to beat it/to move aside
talkative/to speak out of turn/to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/rumors fly
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
to interrupt (sb talking)/to butt in/to cut into a conversation
